item.title: Performance Tuning Methods
item.description: ERPNext Settings Gunicorn Workers ERPNext uses Gunicorn HTTP server in production mode. For optimal performance, the number of gunicorn workers needs to be set according to the number of CPU cores your server has. The recommended number is 2 * num_cores + 1 (Some say this also depends on RAM. For now, stick to 2 * num_cores) It is specified in the common_site_config.json file in the frappe-bench/sites folder. item.title: Investigating Performance Issues
item.description: Prerequisites Access to the AWS Management Console SSH access to EC2 instances Ubuntu (or a compatible Linux distribution) installed on the EC2 instances Procedure A. Initial Analysis Identify the affected EC2 instance(s) or RDS database(s) experiencing performance issues. Monitor user reports and system logs to gather information about the observed issues. Here are some questions that might aid in investigation: When did the site start slowing down?
